basic.description: Analytical methods for nonlinear systems; nonlinear difference equation models:  functional expansions and Volterra, Wiener and Fourier-Hermite kernels; kernel estimation techniques; identification of cascades of linear and static nonlinear systems; use of Volterra series to find region of stability of nonlinear differential equations; applications to pattern recognition, communications, physiological systems, and non-destructive testing. Three term-hours; lectures, Fall. M.J. Korenberg
basic.subject: ELEC
basic.title: Nonlinear Sys. Identification
